name: Forests as Carbon Sinks
title: Top CO2 Absorbing Forests
description: In 2022, Uganda's forests absorbed 43.07 Mt of CO2, showcasing their vital role in carbon sequestration.

name: Safety Nets Need Strengthening
title: Limited Social Safety Coverage
description: In 2016, only 1.52% of Uganda's population was covered by social protection and labor programs, indicating a need for improved social safety nets.

name: Insurance Gaps
title: Minimal Social Insurance Reach
description: In 2016, social insurance programs covered only 0.65% of Uganda's population, with the poorest quintile receiving a mere 0.03% coverage.

name: Fever Fighters
title: High Antimalarial Treatment for Children
description: In 2019, 62.5% of Ugandan children under age 5 with fever received antimalarial drugs, reflecting strong efforts in combating malaria.

name: Progress Against Harmful Practices
title: Low Female Genital Mutilation Prevalence
description: In 2016, Uganda reported a low prevalence of female genital mutilation at just 0.3%, indicating progress in eliminating this harmful practice.
